item.description:
Rental Kayak Available.  Ask Larry for details.

Rental TAKEN.

I just paddled this section of the Mousam River a couple of days ago and I'm very excited about offering this trip.  Later in the fall I'll be posting another trip on a different section of the same river.

The lower Mousam River is both a bird-filled tidal estuary and a serene wooded stream.   We'll paddle four or five easy miles from Kennebunkport to Kennebunk, Maine and experience the river's gradual change from a coastal saltwater estuary to an inland forested river.   Along the way we'll float under a double-arched train bridge and continue upstream until we reach the upper limit of navigable river.  Here, the Mousam becomes a picturesque rocky stream and there's a park where we can have a snack and stretch our legs.   After a break, we'll ride the outgoing tide back to our starting point.

As a bonus, the put-in is a short distance from a gorgeous sandy beach which lies alongside the mouth of the Mousam River. After we load the boats on our cars, we can go for a swim or lounge on the sand and watch our river empty itself out to sea.

 The trip will take about 3 to 4 hours.

Dinner afterward at Federal Jack's, of course!!

Carpool: If you'd like to carpool with someone, please post a comment when you RSVP stating what town you're coming from.  We'll have to park our cars along the road so the fewer the better.

Directions: from I-95 take the Wells exit and follow Route 9 toward Kennebunkport. Rt 9 merges with Rt 1 for a while but follow Rt 9 signs.  When it splits off again from Route 1, follow Route 9 (Western Ave) toward Kennebunkport.  About 2 miles east of RT 1 you'll pass Parsons Beach Rd on the right. Continue on Rt 9 1/4 mile further and park at the bridge.

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.
item.how_to_find_us: Park at the bridge just past Parson's Beach Rd.
item.name: Kayak Kennebunkport to Kennebunk!
